"cofactor_chem_comp_id": "BLM", "cofactor_name": "Bleomycin", "cofactor_resource_id": "DB00290", "mechanism_of_action": "Although the exact mechanism of action of bleomycin is unknown, available evidence would seem to indicate that the main mode of action is the inhibition of DNA synthesis with some evidence of lesser inhibition of RNA and protein synthesis. As evident in _in vitro_ studies, the DNA-cleaving actions of bleomycin is dependent on oxygen and metal ions. It is believed that bleomycin chelates metal ions (primarily iron) producing a pseudoenzyme that reacts with oxygen to produce superoxide and hydroxide free radicals that cleave DNA.", "neighbor_flag": "N", "pubmed_ids": [17202402], "resource_name": "DrugBank", "resource_version": "5.1", "target_resource_id": "P49916"}], "rcsb_id": "3PC7_1"}}, "interface_chains": {"chain1": "nan", "chain2": "nan", "assembly_chain1": "A", "assembly_chain2": "B"}, "enrichment_timestamp": "2026-01-03T13:50:55.142251"}
